articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Two global pioneers of modern gene-editing technology were awarded Monday Israel's prestigious Wolf Prize in medicine.

articles.title: Cop sentenced for using counterfeit bar codes to buy items
articles.description: ELIZABETH, N.J. (AP) — A former police officer convicted of using counterfeit bar codes to pay significantly lower prices for collectibles he bought at stores while in his police uniform has been sentenced to three years in state prison.
articles.content:

articles.title: Trump to promote trade deals in Sunday speech to US farmers
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump will highlight his policies on trade and domestic energy in a speech to U.S. farmers next week, the White House announced Monday.

articles.title: Democratic Rep. Ayanna Pressley announces reelection bid
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — U.S. Rep. Ayanna Pressley is running for a second term in Congress.
articles.content:
BOSTON (AP) U.S. Rep. Ayanna Pressley is running for a second term in Congress.
The Massachusetts Democrat announced her reelection bid in an email to supporters Monday.

articles.title: Incumbent Stanford Taylor won't run for state superintendent
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin's state superintendent of schools, who was appointed to the position in January 2019 after Tony Evers left the job to become governor, said Monday she will not run for a full term in 2021.
articles.content:
